title: weird behaviour of -f --force or force:true programatically
body:
If reporting a bug, please use the following template.
#### Expected behaviour

I need to run multiple instances using a single file, I am using this call. 

```
    pm2.start('modem.js', {name:'someDynamicname',force:true,scriptArgs:'xxx yyy ' },(error,proc)=>{})

```

...
#### Actual behaviour

I have been wondering why my app is not responding properly, this is what happens, I am starting 2 processes, they do open independently. but if i stop both then try to start one, this one will be the only one remaining in pm2, the other stopped process disappears. I tried the same behavior in the CLI, the -f or --force argument will behave weirdly. it wont start more than one process at a time. 
...
#### Steps to reproduce

I did this in the repl having 2 online processes

```
> var pm2 = require('pm2');
pm2.stop(0)//0 uses modem.js 
//this call has a different name than the one that is stopped
pm2.start('modem.js', {name:'anothername'',force:true,scriptArgs:'xxx yyy' )
```

it wont load another instance of the process with the name, it will delete de previous process and create one with the name 'anothername' the behavior I need is that it creates another process with another name
#### Software versions used

```
OS         :ubuntu 16.04
node.js    :v5
PM2        :I have used several, even next, same behaviour
```
#### PM2 Log output

Use the command: `tail --lines 50 ~/.pm2/pm2.log`
